summary: This is a Wells Fargo Bank business records declaration certifying the authenticity of documents produced in response to a legal order related to case number 22361953. The declaration, executed in Charlotte, North Carolina, states that 46 copies of records including checks/debits, deposits, signature cards, and statements were provided, though some electronic transaction images may be missing.

events.title: Wells Fargo Business Records Declaration Execution
events.description: A Wells Fargo employee in the Summons and Subpoenas Department executed a declaration certifying the authenticity of business records produced pursuant to a legal order for case number 22361953.

keyFacts: Wells Fargo Bank produced business records for case number 22361953, which is associated with agency case number 2019R01059.
The records included checks/debits, deposits, signature cards, and statements, totaling 46 copies delivered.
The declaration notes that some electronic transaction images may be missing due to items not being imaged, corrupted, blank, damaged, destroyed, or not available.
The document was executed on September 3, 2019, in Charlotte, North Carolina, under penalty of perjury according to New York state law.
The bank's standard record retention period is seven years, and the records were prepared in the ordinary course of business.
